intro: Eugenia tchambaensis, commonly known as the Tchamba myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain several seeds, and they are often used in local traditional medicine. The tree can grow up to 10 meters tall and is often found in humid, lowland forests.
